msContents.summary: Psalter, Begins with a poem from the Mazmura Dengel. The midpoint of the psalms (66v) is unmarked. Psalm 151 is the short version. The fourth biblical canticle is "Prayer of Hana, mother of Samuel." The Song of Songs is in the common edition, but with some interlinear additions. The Praises of Mary begins on Sunday and culminates on Saturday. Varia: F. i r(ecto), column 1 and : Prayer of supplication. F. i r(ecto), column 2: Asmat prayer to be honored, ክብረ ሰማይ. i v(erso)-ii r(ecto): Calendar: Instructions about the measurement of shadows for the telling of time for the whole year, ስፍረ፡ ሰዓት።. , top margin: contains a list of names of six persons of position. F.170r (in a booklet added into the main book, written in hands of the 20th century): Record of transaction; 170v-171r: record of a family, written in Amharic; 172r: a family geneology written in what appears to be a sheet discarded from another source, written in Amharic. Illuminations (written over the top of text): 77v: Equestrian saint slaying an evil person. 78r: A woman (Mary Magdalene?) washing the feet of a saint (Jesus?).
